sentence.Network_cn: 她有个惹人讨厌的习惯，我跟她说的每一件事她都告诉别人。

sentence.Network_cn: 她对他一心只想着钱感到很厌烦。

entry.def: Something that is irritating keeps annoying you.

example.ex: They also have the irritating habit of interrupting.
example.tran: 他们还有打岔的烦人习惯。

entry.tran: 有刺激性的;引起瘙痒的;引发疼痛的
entry.def: An irritating substance can cause your body to itch or become sore.

example.ex: In heavy concentrations, ozone is irritating to the eyes, nose and throat.
example.tran: 高浓度的臭氧会对眼睛、鼻子和咽喉有刺激作用。

"found it galling to have to ask permission"
"a teasing and persistent thought annoyed him"
"it is vexing to have to admit you are wrong"

sentences.sentence: "bites of black flies are more than irritating; they can be very painful"

Sentence.sentence: They practically beg a user to ignore the long-suffering professor struggling to pass on accumulated wisdom from the front of the room - a prospect that teachers find most irritating and students view as, well, inevitable.
It can forge better relationships and help you cope with life, or it can be corrosive eating away your self-esteem and irritating others.

means.word_mean: 气人的, 使人不愉快的

sentences.en: The man’s worse than irritating,he’s a positive menace!
sentences.cn: 这个人不仅惹人生气,简直是讨厌透了。

sentences.en: He had an irritating habit of singing tunelessly about the house.
sentences.cn: 他有个恼人的习惯，老在屋子里不成调地唱歌。

sentences.en: He has this irritating mannerism of constantly scratching his nose.
sentences.cn: 他老是挠鼻子，这个习惯真让人不舒服。
